attributes.comment:
I write to you today to ask that fees for the I-600A and fingerprinting processes not
be increased. As you know, these processes are key components in families'
efforts to adopt children from overseas. The expense involved in state, federal,
and country specific paperwork already stretches the abilities of many families.
With the length of time that many of us must wait before our paperwork is
approved by the foreign government, our 171s and fingerprint approvals are
expiring before we can travel to adopt our children. This means that we have to go
through the entire application process again and that any fee increase will hit
families twice as hard.

My hope is that these fee increases can be avoided and that funding can be
generated from other sources. Ideally sources that do not involve efforts to provide
loving homes for children in need.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By CLM Manyin
